page.title: 18British Legion Club, Norton
page.content: The British Legion Club is like a public house where ex-service people go to have a drink and a chat with their friends. They may prefer to play Bingo or Darts. Certain members known as "Sea- Members" are people who have been voted into the club but were not in the Armed Forces. They cannot hold Office. Ladies can join the club and can go on the committee. The club is open every day, except Tuesday, and is used by people from surrounding villages. The land on which it stands belonged to F.W. King. When he died, he left all his money and land to The British Legion. On that land they built the club house that stands today. There are also British Legion Clubs at Pinvin and Worcester.
